chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (7th, 8th or 9th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John James Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John James Erickson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John James Erickson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to current prison sentence. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: current prison sentence

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.
